intro: Daviesia debilior, commonly known as the slender daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open woodlands and heathlands. Daviesia debilior is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
